main event: A circular white object with a red light was observed moving up and down in Newburgh, New York on 13 October 1956.
interesting points: The object was described as being the size of a pinhead at arm's length., The object emitted a bright blue-white fluorescent color., It drifted over to the moon and disappeared., The sighting lasted for 45 minutes., There had been a considerable number of balloons launched in the area around that time.
sighted object: circular white object with red light
witness description: civilian observer who reported the sighting
